page.title: 05EDUCATION
page.content: THE CHILDREN MAY ATTEND A PRIVATELY RUN PRE-SCHOOL PLAYGROUP FROM THE AGE OF THREE AND START COMPULSORY EDUCATION IN THEIR FIFTH YEAR. FREE TRANSPORT IS PROVIDED TO STATE-RUN PRIMARY SCHOOLS OUTSIDE THE AREA. AT THE AGE OF ELEVEN-PLUS PUPILS TRANSFER TO THE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL IN ABERGAVENNY. AFTER COMPLETING THEIR SCHOOL-LEAVING EXAMINATIONS AT SIXTEEN,A FEW PUPILS CONTINUE INTO THE SIXTH FORM TO PREPARE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION AT EIGHTEEN,WHEN THEY PROCEED TO COLLEGES OR UNIVERSITES. THE LOCAL AUTHORITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ACCORDING TO NEED. A WIDE VARIETY OF ADULT EVENING CLASSES ARE AVAILABLE IN NEARBY TOWNS. ADULTS MAY CHOOSE TO CONTINUE HIGHER EDUCATION IN LATER LIFE AS 'MATURE' STUDENTS.ABOUT 2% OF PARENTS PAY FOR PRIVATE EDUCATION OF THEIR CHILDREN.
